results.title: William Delafield Cook interviewed by Deborah Hart...
results.creator_credit: Ian Stocks, Deborah Hart and Queensland Art Gallery
results.brief_description: This video provides a unique opportunity to explore the ideas and works of the Australian born artist William Delafield Cook. Produced in conjunction with the artist’s Retrospective at the Art Gallery of New South Wales, it covers the stylistic development of his art from the 1950’s to the present day. Delafield Cook lives and works both in England and Australia. Widely travelled, his art embodies an exceptionally diverse interest in art history, photography and films.

results.title: Philharmonic safari: the London Philharmonic Orchestra "down under"
results.creator_credit: Don Shepherd and Shepherd Baker Studios
results.brief_description: A magical documentary where the story is told through the combination of stunning images, beautiful sounds of orchestral music, and minimal commentary. It is a contrast of seasons and of cultures - winter in London, summer in Australia. This is a musical journey that takes you half-way around the globe with one of the world’s greatest orchestras, the London Philharmonic Orchestra. The story begins in a snow-covered wintery London with a performance by the London Philharmonic Orchestra, conducted by Klaus Tennstedt, at the Royal Festival Hall. Next, the orchestra boards a Qantas flight bound for Perth and their final destination, the magnificent Leeuwin Estate, a vineyard 250 kilometres south of Perth. It is here under the Australian night sky that the London Philharmonic Orchestra, conducted by Avi Ostrowski, will perform to an audience of around 4,500 enthusiastic and appreciative music lovers.

results.title: The Bradman era
results.creator_credit: Jack Egan, Albie Thoms and ABC Video
results.brief_description: This film, a companion to the book, traces the career of Sir Donald Bradman from the early 1930s through until 1948 when he led an undefeated Australian team in England in his last test series. The film also contains coverage of many of the controversial incidents during the “Bodyline” series in 1932-33 and shows the great players in action. Rated: G

results.title: Market of dreams
results.brief_description: With little understanding of the meanings or the origins of Australian Aboriginal art, the international art market has eagerly, almost obscenely, embraced this most ancient cultural tradition. This significant, ironic documentary does not presume to make judgements on the artists and the analysts, the prophets and the profiteers, the critics and collectors. The images and stories speak for themselves. Features artists, Ronnie Tjampitjinpa, Michael Jagamara Nelson, Darby Jampijinpa, Dolly Nampijinpo Granites, Uta Uta Tjangala and Turkey Tolson Tjupurrlo. Gold Medal Winner, International Film & Television Festival, New York, 1991.

results.title: Seen one, seen 'em all
results.brief_description: This program looks at media representation of ethnic and minority groups. The video uses a zany quiz show format to raise questions about ethnic stereotyping using examples from advertising. Both the video and its accompanying study guide provide a launching point for classroom discussion, activity and further study, suitable for a wide range of age groups.

results.title: Australian Bush Music
results.brief_description: Features the Mucky Duck Bush Band singing a selection of Australian folk songs, and explains the background of various songs and the instruments used to play them.

results.title: Images of the land: 100 years of Australian landscapes
results.creator_credit: Ian Stocks and Queensland Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Highlights the work of some of Australia’s most important artists from the 19th century to the present time. Includes the works of Arthur Streeton, Hans Heysen, Russell Drysdale, Sidney Nolan, Fred Williams and others who present us with their visions of the Australian landscape.

results.title: Appearances can deceive: offenders with intellectual disabilities
results.creator_credit: Bob Kingsbury, Suzanne Baker, New South Wales Film Corporation, New South Wales. Premier's Dept. Disability Services Co-ordination Unit and Suzanne Baker Productions
results.brief_description: Designed to improve awareness of intellectually disabled offenders in the criminal justice system, given that this group comprise a disproportionate percentage of both the prison population and juvenile offenders held in institutions. Re-enacts a shop lifting offence by an intellectually disabled youth and follows the case from initial apprehension by the store detective and police interviewing to the arrest and court proceedings. Emphasises the importance of liason with community agencies.

results.title: The Volunteer Youth Program
results.creator_credit: Jack White, Andrew Scollo and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: Highlights the depressing effect that prolonged unemployment can have upon a young person’s self-confidence and that involvement in community work can provide an opportunity for people between jobs to exercise a sense of choice in their career. Explains the resources of the Volunteer Youth Program providing a sample of the range of activities - theatre, public radio and child care.
